p: Depending on the agroecological region, sorghum, millet, and maize are the primary staple crops in Mali. Sorghum is widely cultivated across the Sudan Savannah and covers a range of agroecological zones characterized by a gradation in rainfall from the edge of the Sahara Desert to the fertile Niger River Delta. Development efforts led by the Malian government have been aimed at improving staple crop yields since the drought years that occurred in the 1970s and 1980s. Initially these efforts involved breeding with foreign genetic material but more recently has been focused on Guinea races that are traditional West African sorghum varieties ( Rattunde et al. 2013).
